articles.summary: A new PET imaging agent can accurately detect neurotensin receptor 1 expression in lung tumors, potentially improving cancer diagnosis and treatment monitoring.

articles.title: Targeting UCHL3 attenuates pathological markers in neuronal models of Huntington's disease.
articles.summary: By reducing UCHL3 in Huntington's disease neuronal models, researchers decreased mutant protein aggregates and improved cellular stress resistance.

articles.title: Clinical Effectiveness and Safety of Chinese Herbal Enema for Ulcerative Colitis: An Evidence-Based Study.
articles.summary: Chinese herbal enemas showed significant clinical improvements for ulcerative colitis patients, outperforming standard treatments in managing inflammation and symptoms.

articles.title: Aspirin and Atorvastatin Augmentation Treatment in Patients with Major Affective Disorders and Inflammatory Dysregulation: A 12-Week Randomized Placebo-Controlled Study.
articles.summary: Aspirin and atorvastatin combined showed potential to improve treatment outcomes for patients with major affective disorders experiencing inflammatory dysregulation.

articles.title: Heterogeneous Magnetic Resonance Nanoprobe for Assisting Liver Fibrosis Three-Dimensional Reconstruction and Cascaded Therapy.
articles.summary: A nanoplatform with targeted magnetic resonance imaging and enzyme therapy effectively diagnoses and treats liver fibrosis by inhibiting cell activation and collagen production.

articles.title: GLP-1RAs versus metformin and Parkinson's risk in type 2 diabetes.
articles.summary: In patients with type 2 diabetes, GLP-1 receptor agonists showed potential neuroprotective effects against Parkinson's disease compared to metformin, warranting further research.

articles.title: Ferroptosis in Spine-Related Diseases: Mechanistic Insights and Potential Therapeutic Targets.
articles.summary: The research explores ferroptosis, a cell death mechanism involving iron accumulation, and its potential role in understanding and treating spine-related diseases and injuries.

articles.title: A retrospective study of treatment and outcomes in synchronous systemic and central nervous system large B-cell lymphoma.
articles.summary: For patients with synchronous systemic and CNS large B-cell lymphoma, R-CHOP-M treatment with stem cell transplant for high-risk patients improved survival outcomes.

articles.title: Inhibition of the RORC/GPX4 mediated ferroptosis regulatory axis suppresses tumor growth and alleviates enzalutamide resistance in prostate cancer.
articles.summary: Ilicicolin A may help overcome drug resistance in prostate cancer by blocking a specific cellular pathway that promotes tumor survival and treatment resistance.

articles.title: Casticin in cancer research: in vitro evidence and mechanistic insights into its antitumor potential.
articles.summary: Casticin, a natural compound, inhibits cancer cell growth by targeting multiple cellular pathways and inducing various forms of programmed cell death.

articles.summary: Cancer-associated fibroblasts regulate lipocalin-2 expression, promoting lung cancer cell resistance to immunotherapy and increasing tumor aggressiveness.

articles.summary: A new PET imaging agent can noninvasively detect neurotensin receptor 1 expression in lung tumors, potentially improving cancer diagnosis and treatment monitoring.

articles.summary: Chinese herbal enemas showed significant clinical improvements for ulcerative colitis patients when combined with standard medications or used as monotherapies.

articles.title: Aspirin and Atorvastatin Augmentation Treatment in Patients with Major Affective Disorders and Inflammatory Dysregulation: A 12-Week Randomized Placebo-Controlled Study.

articles.summary: For patients with synchronous systemic and central nervous system large B-cell lymphoma, R-CHOP-M chemotherapy with possible stem cell transplant can improve survival, especially for those with favorable prognostic factors.

articles.summary: A targeted nanocomplex selectively activates T-cell immune responses in metastatic lymph nodes, effectively inhibiting tumor growth and improving survival.

articles.title: Pathophysiological and behavioral consequences of dichlorvos-induced oxidative stress in rodent models: A systematic review of mechanisms and protective strategies.
articles.summary: DDVP insecticide induces severe oxidative stress in rodents, causing multi-organ damage and neurobehavioral changes, with potential mitigation through targeted antioxidant interventions.

articles.title: Nuclear receptors-mediated lipid metabolism dysregulation: A potential mechanism linking PFOA/PFOS to hepatocellular carcinoma.
articles.summary: Endocrine-disrupting chemicals PFOA and PFOS can impair lipid metabolism in liver cells by interfering with estrogen receptor binding, potentially promoting liver cancer development.

articles.title: Therapeutic targeting of the HPV E7 oncoprotein: Current advances and emerging strategies.
articles.summary: Researchers are developing targeted therapies to block HPV's E7 protein in cervical cancer, using methods like immunotherapy and gene editing to halt cancer cell growth.

articles.title: Microbial metabolite FAD mobilizes adipocyte lipid remodeling to enhance cancer immunotherapy efficacy.
articles.summary: FAD from gut bacteria enhances cancer immunotherapy by boosting fat cell lipid changes and improving T cell activity against tumors.

articles.title: Anti-tumor effect of ardicrenin against MG63 osteosarcoma cells.
articles.summary: Ardicrenin from Ardisia crenata effectively inhibits osteosarcoma cell growth by targeting integrin signaling, offering a potential new cancer treatment approach.

articles.title: PFKFB4-Mediated HSPB1 phosphorylation suppresses ferroptosis to Promote gastric cancer progression.
articles.summary: In gastric cancer, PFKFB4 promotes cancer progression by phosphorylating HSPB1, which suppresses ferroptosis and helps tumor cells survive.

articles.title: Naja nigricollis venom elicits repro-toxicity in organs of female rats: clinical implications of snakebite envenoming on reproductive health.
articles.summary: Naja nigricollis snake venom significantly disrupts female reproductive organs in rats, causing hormonal imbalances, oxidative stress, and inflammation.

articles.title: Hyaluronic acid-coated amphiphilic polyaspartic acid-drug conjugates self-assembling nanoparticles for tumor specific fluorescence imaging and chemotherapy.
articles.summary: A novel nanoparticle delivery system using hyaluronic acid coating can selectively target and treat breast cancer (4T1) by releasing chemotherapy drugs in tumor cells.

articles.title: AF6 knockout-induced upregulation of bile acid production promotes CXCL14-mediated antitumor immunity in HCC: Effect of the BA/Butyrate/CXCL14 axis in HCC.
articles.summary: In liver cancer, removing AF6 increases bile acid production, enhancing immune responses that could help fight tumor growth.

articles.title: Î±-lipoic acid and L-serine conjugated chitosan as a stimuli-responsive drug delivery platform.
articles.summary: ChiLipo-Ser nanoparticles effectively delivered curcumin to HeLa and HT29 cancer cells, demonstrating potential as a targeted drug delivery system.

articles.title: CRISPR-based chemogenomic profiling reveals redox vulnerabilities to epigallocatechin-3-gallate and green tea polyphenol extract.

articles.title: Adapting antibody-invertase fusion protein immunoassays to multiwell plates for infectious disease antibody quantification.
articles.summary: Researchers developed a new antibody detection method using an antibody-invertase fusion protein that enables precise COVID-19 antibody quantification using affordable glucometers in a 96-well plate format.

articles.title: NIR-II-Photopyroelectric Catalysis for Immunoactivation/Ferroptosis Combined Therapy of Tumor.
articles.summary: ZnS:Cu nanoparticles use near-infrared light to generate hydrogen, trigger immunoactivation, and induce ferroptosis in tumors, enhancing cancer treatment effectiveness.

articles.title: The gene encoding ornithine decarboxylase for putrescine biosynthesis is essential for the viability of Fusobacterium nucleatum.
articles.summary: Researchers found that the putrescine-producing gene oda is crucial for Fusobacterium nucleatum's survival, affecting its cell membrane and growth.

articles.title: Caylobolide B: Structure Revision, Total Synthesis, Biological Characterization, and Discovery of New Analogues.
articles.summary: Researchers refined the structure of caylobolide B from a marine organism and found it disrupts cell membranes, potentially offering a new approach to developing therapeutic compounds.

articles.title: An H2O2 activated Ag2S:In-Cu nanoprobe for in vitro synergistic tumor treatment.
articles.summary: Ag2S nanoparticles with added indium and copper effectively generate heat and reactive oxygen species to kill tumor cells under near-infrared light.

articles.title: Tumor-produced ammonia is metabolized by regulatory T cells to further impede anti-tumor immunity.
articles.summary: In hepatocellular carcinoma, regulatory T cells convert tumor-produced ammonia into metabolites that enhance their immunosuppressive abilities, potentially blocking cancer treatment.

articles.title: A Multifunctional Prodrug with the DNA Damage Amplification Effect for Inducing Immunogenic Cell Death.
articles.summary: A novel prodrug effectively kills tumor cells by amplifying DNA damage and triggering immune response, demonstrating potential for cancer immunotherapy without significant side effects.

articles.title: Targeting a Glutamic Acid in PDEÎ´ with Fluoromethyl-Aryl Electrophiles Impairs K-Ras Signaling.
articles.summary: A novel fluorinated compound called Deltafluorine effectively disrupts K-Ras signaling in lung cancer by targeting a specific protein site, reducing tumor growth in mice.

articles.summary: Umbelliferon-vanilloid hybrid compounds effectively inhibit specific cancer-related enzymes and show promising anti-lung cancer activity by targeting tumor cell proliferation and metastasis.

articles.title: Structure-Based Design of Pan-Selective Peptide Epoxyketones for the Three Human Immunoproteasome Active Sites.
articles.summary: Researchers discovered a new peptide (BocPip-Ser) that selectively targets immunoproteasome sites, potentially offering a more precise treatment for hematological cancers with fewer side effects.

articles.title: Photoelectrochemical detection of epigenetic 5-hydroxymethylcytosine based on Cu2O@CuO@Ag and self-triggered isothermal amplification.
articles.summary: Researchers developed a highly sensitive method using a novel nanomaterial to detect 5-hydroxymethylcytosine, a potential early biomarker for tumor diagnosis.

articles.title: Icosahedral Carborane: A Safe Albumin Binder for Augmenting Radiopharmaceuticals' Tumor Uptake and Retention.
articles.summary: Icosahedral carborane, a safe molecular modifier, enhances tumor-targeting radioligands' effectiveness by prolonging blood circulation and improving tumor uptake across multiple cancer targets.

articles.title: Quantifying biological effects of spatially heterogeneous carbon ion dose distributions using EUD.
articles.summary: Carbon ion radiation targeting tumor cells demonstrated enhanced cytotoxicity at high linear energy transfer and dose heterogeneity, suggesting potential for improved cancer treatment precision.

articles.title: Clinical hurdles for curcumin and piperine nanoparticles in prostate cancer treatment: a bridge too far or a path to clinical reality?
articles.summary:
I'll help draft a clear summary sentence. Here's one focused on the key message:

Nanoparticle-delivered curcumin and piperine show promise for overcoming bioavailability challenges in prostate cancer treatment.

articles.title: Epigenetically-controlled CEBPB regulates kidney cancer tumorigenesis via GPD1L-mediated ether lipid synthesis.
articles.summary: In kidney cancer, the transcription factor CEBPB drives tumor growth by disrupting lipid metabolism and boosting cancer cell survival through ether lipid production.

articles.title: Case Report of Concomitant Pleuropulmonary Blastoma and Hepatoblastoma in a 25-Month-Old Child With a Germline DICER1 Pathogenic Variant.
articles.summary: A 25-month-old boy with a rare genetic mutation developed two simultaneous rare childhood tumors (pleuropulmonary blastoma and hepatoblastoma) in his lungs and liver.

articles.title: A CD36-Targeting Thermosensitive Berberine Nanogel Blocks Tumor Lipid Hijacking and Potentiates Anti-PD-L1 Immunotherapy in Triple-Negative Breast Cancer.
articles.summary: A thermosensitive nanogel delivering berberine targets CD36 in triple-negative breast cancer, reducing lipid accumulation and enhancing immunotherapy effectiveness.

articles.title: ROS-responsive multifunctional DCS-based micelle hydrogel for simultaneously inhibiting post-resection melanoma recurrence and promoting wound healing.
articles.summary: A novel micelle hydrogel for melanoma treatment simultaneously inhibits tumor recurrence and promotes wound healing by targeting cancer cells and supporting tissue recovery.

articles.title: Role of the EPA: DHA dosing ratio in omega-3 supplements on blood fatty acid profiles and inflammation: a systematic review and meta-analysis.
articles.summary: Omega-3 supplements with EPA:DHA ratios below 1.0 effectively reduce inflammation markers and improve blood fatty acid profiles, especially in individuals with underlying health conditions.

articles.title: Nanozyme-Based Therapeutics: Bridging Catalysis and Nanomedicine.
articles.summary: Nanozymes are engineered nanoparticles with enzyme-like properties that show potential for targeted cancer therapy by responding to tumor microenvironmental stimuli.

articles.title: Contrasting Prognostic Roles of Stromal Periostin Expression and Immune Cells Infiltration in Colorectal Carcinoma.
articles.summary: In colorectal cancer, the interaction between stromal proteins and immune cells in the tumor environment can significantly influence patient survival outcomes.

articles.title: Global evolution of ferroptosis research: a comprehensive bibliometric analysis of publication trends, geographic patterns, pharmacological innovation, and translational progress from inception through 2025.
articles.summary: Bibliometric analysis reveals ferroptosis research is rapidly expanding, with China leading publications and increasing focus on cancer therapies and potential therapeutic interventions.

articles.title: Experimental and clinical insights into the therapeutic potential of Berberis vulgaris and its bioactive constituents in respiratory, allergic, and immunological disorders: a comprehensive review.
articles.summary: Berberis vulgaris demonstrates potential in managing respiratory disorders by reducing inflammation and modulating immune responses through its bioactive compounds.

articles.title: Deep learning-accelerated 3D flair for white matter lesion detection in multiple sclerosis: a feasibility study.

articles.title: Anti-thymocyte globulin-based treatment frequently leads to enduring treatment success in both old and young adult patients with aplastic anaemia: a real-world analysis from the Dutch aplastic anaemia registry.
articles.summary: Anti-thymocyte globulin treatment shows promising long-term success in aplastic anaemia patients, with 42% achieving treatment-free survival across age groups.

articles.title: Pembrolizumab and Paclitaxel in HR+/HER2- Breast Cancer with HER2-Enriched or Basal-Like Subtypes.
articles.summary: Pembrolizumab combined with paclitaxel showed potential effectiveness in treating hormone receptor-positive, HER2-negative breast cancer with HER2-enriched or basal-like subtypes.

articles.title: A meta-analysis of immunosuppressive and Pharmacological therapies in aplastic anaemia with and without Indigenous equine antithymocyte globulin (eATG).
articles.summary: In Indian aplastic anaemia patients, combining equine antithymocyte globulin with cyclosporine A and eltrombopag significantly improved treatment response rates compared to single-drug therapies.

articles.title: IDH1 Reprograms Nucleotide Metabolism by Inducing Chromatin Remodeling and DHODH Transcription to Drive Chemoresistance in Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma.
articles.summary: In nasopharyngeal carcinoma, IDH1 enzyme promotes chemotherapy resistance by reprogramming metabolism and protecting cells from drug-induced damage.

articles.title: Statistical process control of CBCT density gamma analysis as a clinical trigger for offline adaptive radiotherapy.
articles.summary: Statistical process control analysis of cone-beam CT density gamma passing rates can help identify anatomical changes and guide adaptive radiotherapy across different cancer sites.

articles.title: Trajectories of cigarette smoking and exposure to welding fumes and their impact on lung cancer risks: a latent class modelling approach.
articles.summary: Lung cancer risk varies based on individual patterns of cigarette smoking and welding fume exposure, not just total exposure amount.

articles.title: SLC25A45: a gatekeeper for methylated amino acid metabolism.
articles.summary: SLC25A45 is a mitochondrial transporter that helps synthesize carnitine, revealing new insights into cellular metabolism and potential metabolic pathway interactions.

articles.title: Mechanism of Astragalus Polysaccharides Regulating Ferroptosis and Inhibiting Malignant Progression of Ovarian Cancer Cells.
articles.summary: Astragalus polysaccharides inhibit ovarian cancer cell growth by triggering cell death and blocking cancer progression through a specific cellular signaling pathway.

articles.title: Beyond metabolism: exploring the regulatory and therapeutic implications of lactate and lactylation in cancer-regulated cell death.
articles.summary: Lactate and lactylation influence multiple cell death processes in cancer, offering potential new therapeutic strategies to combat tumor resistance and progression.

articles.title: Effect of a behavioral counseling for adoption and maintenance of a physically active lifestyle on long-term mortality in people with type 2 diabetes: post hoc analysis of the Italian Diabetes and Exercise Study_2.
articles.summary: Behavioral counseling focused on physical activity significantly reduced long-term mortality, particularly cancer deaths, in people with type 2 diabetes.

articles.title: Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease and related neuropathies.
articles.summary: Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease is a complex inherited neurological disorder causing progressive muscle weakness and sensory deficits, with no current disease-modifying treatments available.

articles.title: Free-breathing phase-resolved functional lung (PREFUL) low-field magnetic resonance imaging (LF-MRI) of pulmonary dysfunction after surviving childhood cancer.

articles.title: MHC1-TIP enables single-tube multimodal immunopeptidome profiling and uncovers intratumoral heterogeneity in antigen presentation.
articles.summary: MHC1-TIP enables comprehensive, low-input profiling of cancer antigens, revealing significant intratumoral heterogeneity in renal cell carcinoma antigen presentation.

articles.title: Do team sports have positive effects on anxiety levels and mood disorders? A systematic review protocol.
